text: Tehran soroosh cinema Soroush Cinema (; formerly known as: Moulin Rouge Cinema () is one of the old cinema of Tehran which opened on October 15, 1956.http://jamejamonline.ir/online/671449249970035103http://www.tabnak.ir/fa/news/337051/%D9%81%DB%8C%D9%84%D9%85-%D8%B3%D8%B1%D9%86%D9%88%D8%B4%D8%AA-%D9%85%D8%AA%D9%81%D8%A7%D9%88%D8%AA-%D8%AF%D9%88-%D8%B3%DB%8C%D9%86%D9%85%D8%A7-%D8%A8%D8%A7-%DB%8C%DA%A9-%D9%86%D8%A7%D9%85-%D8%AF%D8%B1-%D8%A7%DB%8C%D8%B1%D8%A7%D9%86-%D9%88-%D8%A2%D9%85%D8%B1%DB%8C%DA%A9%D8%A7the first movie showed in this cinema was Trapeze. Moulin Rouge cinema was designed by Heydar Ghiai, a pioneer of modern architecture in Iranhttps://www.arel.ir/gallery/%D9%85%D8%B9%D9%85%D8%A7%D8%B1%DB%8C-%D8%B3%D8%A7%D8%AE%D8%AA%D9%85%D8%A7%D9%86-%D8%B3%DB%8C%D9%86%D9%85%D8%A7-%D8%B3%D8%B1%D9%88%D8%B4/http://www.iranicaonline.org/articles/giai- haydar.The Chain Cinemas of Moulin Rouge included eight cinemas which founded by akhavan brothers in 1955.http://www.hozehonari.com/PrintListItem.aspx?id=54656 These cinemas were named Mahtab, Berelian, zohre, Crystal and Moulin Rouge. These cinemas showed movies from Paramount Pictures and United Artists studios. This cinema is located in Shariati Street. It has been closed for a short time due to renovation and opened again on August 2013.The first movie shown in this cinema after renovation was Shahre moshha 2http://www.hamshahrionline.ir/details/271633/cinema/iraniancinemaThe new Cinema Soroush has three saloons with capacity of 330 , 200 and 100 person each.http://seeiran.ir/%D8%B3%DB%8C%D9%86%D9%85%D8%A7-%D8%B3%D8%B1%D9%88%D8%B4-%D8%AA%D9%87%D8%B1%D8%A7%D9%86/ ==References== Category:Buildings and structures in Tehran Category:1956 establishments in Iran Category:Cinemas in Iran Category:Buildings and structures completed in 1956
title: Soroush Cinema
